intro.p: I created this catalogue to keep track of my personal collection of books. It's divided into two sections: Fiction and Non-Fiction. All of my fictional books are organized by author, and all of my non-fictional books are organized into subjects and sub-subjects.

I created this repository as part of a final assignment for ENGL 407, a class on XML at the UNiversity of Victoria. I chose this project because I wanted a system that would allow me to keep track of the location of my books, the last time I read them, how many times I've read them, how I came to have these books, and anything else that might be relevant. As such, this is a very personal project. However, it will also allow me to easily share my collection with anyone who cares to know, and will act as a record in case I am forced to get rid of my books or if they are lost for any reason.
A copy of the XML, XSD, CSS, and README files that go with this project can be accessed from my GitHub account. You can find that at https://github.com/josiegray/Library-Catalogue.

This content is under a CC BY 4.0 International Licence. Under the terms of this licence, you can share, edit, remix, and revise this content as long as you provide attribution and describe any changes you may have made. "Josie's Library Catalogue" by Josie Gray is under a CC BY 4.0 International Licence.

series.summary: While these books aren't directly connected, they all take place in the same universe with some overlapping characters.

book.title: Graceling
book.summary: Katsa is graced with the ability to kill. As the king's neice, she is used as a tool of the realm, diciplining nobles who resist the king's demands. However, her resistance to her uncle's demands slowly grows, and when she finally disobey's his orders, she is forced to go on the run.

notes.p: I have an audiobook for this book on Itunes.

book.title: Sofia Petrovna
book.summary: A novella describing life in the Soviet Union during the Great Purge. It is one of the few surviving accounts of this event that was actually written during the purge era.

notes.p: This book was assigned by Dr. Dolf in his History of the Soviet Union class. I don't think I actually read it.

series.rating: 3 - Like, but probably won't read again

series.summary: Katniss Everdeen lives in the future, post-apocalyptic nation of Panem in North America. The Capitol, a highly advanced metropolis, exercises political control over the rest of the nation. The Hunger Games is an annual event in which one boy and one girl aged 12–18 from each of the twelve districts surrounding the Capitol are selected by lottery to compete in a televised battle to the death.

book.title: Catching Fire
book.summary: Katniss learns that her defiance in the previous novel has started a chain reaction that has inspired rebellion in the districts. President Snow threatens to harm Katniss' family and friends if she does not help to defuse the unrest in the districts and marry Peeta.

book.title: Mockingjay
book.summary: Katniss Everdeen agrees to unify the districts of Panem in a rebellion against the Capitol.

notes.p: This was one of my favourite books growing up. "Mad I may be, but I will never be convenient.
I have all of these books as audio books as well.

book.title: Room
book.rating: 3 - Like, but probably won't read again
book.summary: The story is told from the perspective of a five-year-old boy, Jack, who is being held captive in a small room along with his mother.

book.title: The Pillars of the Earth
book.summary: This book is about the building of a cathedral in the fictional town of Kingsbridge, England. It is set in the middle of the 12th century. The book traces the development of Gothic architecture out of the preceding Romanesque architecture, and the fortunes of the Kingsbridge priory and village against the backdrop of historical events of the time.

series.summary: This series follows the life of Claire Beauchamp, who ends up travelling back in time to 16th century Scotland and falls in love with a Highland Scott. The series is also being made into a TV show, which is excellent.

notes.p: I only got halfway through this book.
These books are ones that I recommend to dudes when they ask me for recommendations. They are written by a male author

book.title: BZRK
book.rating: 3 - Like, but probably won't read again

book.title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
book.summary: Disgraced-journalist Mikael Blomkvist and troubled computer hacker Lisbeth Salander are hired by a prominent businessman to look into the disappearance of his grandniece 37 years ago.

book.title: The Girl Who Played with Fire
book.rating: 3 - Like, but probably won't read again

book.title: The Girl Who Kicked the Hornets' Nest
book.rating: 3 - Like, but probably won't read again

series.summary: Set in the fictional realm of Narnia, a fantasy world of magic, mythical beasts, and talking animals, the series narrates the adventures of various children who play central roles in the unfolding history of that world.

notes.p: This series is combined into one large book.

book.title: The Lion, the Witch, and the Wardrobe
The Voyage of the Dawn Treader

notes.p: I think this is my favourite of all of these books. But I would have to read it again to be sure.

book.title: We Were Liars
book.rating: 3 - Like, but probably won't read again
book.summary: We Were Liars focuses on the theme of self-acceptance, family morals, and the possibly-deadly consequences of one's mistakes. It is centered on the wealthy, seemingly perfect Sinclair family, who spend every summer gathered on their private island. However, not every summer is the same—when something happens to Cadence during the summer of her fifteenth year, the four "Liars" (Cadence, Johnny, Gat and Mirren) re-emerge two years later to prompt Cadence to remember the incident.

notes.p: This book was assigned by Karen Rivers in her class on Writing for Children and Young Adults (WRIT 406). Although I remember not really enjoying the book, the twist ending makes it all worth it. This book is heartbreaking and has the potential to make you cry.
I read the first book in this series a long time ago. So I can't remember what happened. But I think it was a good one. I never ended up reading the second.

series.seriesname: A Song of Ice and Fire

notes.p: I have read the first book and half of the second in this series. The story contains so many points of view and characters that it hard to follow. I'll try reading them all again when I have time to spend a lot of time reading. I want to be able to read the books before I watch the TV shows.
Mom got me this book for Christmas in 2017.

book.title: The Paris Wife
book.summary: This book follows Hadley, who falls in love with and marries Ernest Hemingway. They soon move to Paris, and the book follows the course of their relationship.

notes.p: I got this book from Melanie Basso. The language of this book is beautiful, but the story is sad.
I really don't remember what happened in this book, but I remember liking it. I should reread it at some point.

book.title: Rampant
book.summary: A story about a girl who learns to hunt unicorns.. killer unicorns.

notes.p: I remember really liking this book. But I don't know if that's just because I was so young when I read it. I should read it again to refresh my memory.
I don't think I ever read this. But I've had it for a long time.
I think I have this as an audiobook somewhere. Itunes?

book.title: In the Hand of the Goddess
The Woman Who Rides Like a Man
First Test
book.summary: Keladry of Mindelan, a young girl who becomes the first female to train as a knight ten years after King Jonathan first declared it legal. The novel tracks the first year of Keladry's training, during which she is only accepted on a probationary basis. Keladry must struggle to prove herself worthy to palace training master Wyldon of Cavall and her fellow page trainees.

notes.p: This book was a Christmas gift from mom. I think I was in grade 5 (2005). It was the first Tamora Pierce book I ever read.

series.summary: All Ali has ever wanted to do is be a spy, but her father, the realm's spy master, forbids her. While out sailing one day, Ali is kidnapped and sold as a slave in another country. A trickster god takes an interest in her, and puts her to work in a disgraced noble household where Ali becomes involved in a growing resistance movement.

book.title: Crown Duel
book.summary: Insert here

book.title: One Day in the Life of Ivan Denisovisch
book.summary: An account of one day in the life of a man who has been sentenced to a labour prison camp in Soviet Russia in the 1950s.

notes.p: I can't remember ever reading this book. But I've had it for a long time.
This book was assigned in my History of Vampires in Literature and Film class (GMST 454).

book.title: The Hate U Give
book.summary: This book follows a protagonist drawn to activism after she witnesses the police shooting of her unarmed friend.

notes.p: This book was assigned by Karen Rivers in her class on Writing for Children and Young Adults (WRIT 406).
This book is moving and powerful. It deals with issues of police violence and the shootings of unarmed black men in the United States.

book.title: Candide and Other Stories
book.summary: A collection of Voltaire's "philosophical tales" that were published during the Enlightenment.

notes.p: This book was assigned by Dr. Walshaw in her History of Modern Europe class.

book.title: Before I Go to Sleep
book.rating: 3 - Like, but probably won't read again
book.summary: After an accident, a woman loses her ability to make new memories, and every time she goes to sleep, the memories she's made that day disappear. She begins to work with a psychologist to repair her memories, and begins to realize that her husband is lying to her.

notes.p: The movie for this book is really good.

book.title: A House in the Sky
book.rating: 3 - Like, but probably won't read again
book.summary: While working as a journalist in Somalia, Amanda and a man she is working with are captured and held for ransom for fifteen months. This book is a memoir of Amanda's life leading up to and including her time in captivity.

notes.p: This book was extremely interesting, but hard to read at times. Grandpa Gray gave it to me. I don't think he read it, but Amanda grew up in Red Deer, Alberta, so he would have read about her story in the news.
I lent this book out to Tokai before Christmas (2017). He still has it.

book.title: A Girl in the Woods
book.subtitle: A Memoir
book.summary: After a traumatic event, a woman decides to hike from Mexico to Canada.

notes.p: I got this book from Taylor when she left to travel Europe.

book.title: Men Without Women
book.subtitle: Stories
book.summary: A collection of short stories by Japanese author Haruki Murakami, translated and published in English in 2017. The stories are about men who have lost their women, usually to other men or death.

notes.p: March 2018: Taylor gave me this book when she was downsizing to leave for Europe.
This book was assigned by Dr. Dryden in her Canadian Political History class (HSTR 322B)
This book was assigned in Dr. Sitara's Canadian History: Post Confederation Class (HSTR 235B).
This book was assigned by Dr. Saunders in his History of the Modern Middle East class. I ended up dropping it after a few weeks.

book.title: A History of Modern Europe
book.subtitle: From the Renaissance to the Age of Napoleon

notes.p: This book was assigned in Dr. Walshaw's History of the Modern Middle East class (a first year course).
This book was assigned by Dr. Bunton in his History of the Israeli-Palestinian Conflict class (HSTR 378).

book.title: Imperial Life in the Emerald City
book.subtitle: Inside Iraq's Green Zone

notes.p: This book was assigned in a History of the Middle East after World War II class. I wrote a book review on this book.

book.title: A History of the Modern Middle East

notes.p: This book was assigned by Dr. Bunton in his History of the Modern Middle East class (HSTR 277A).
It offers a general survey of the history of the modern Middle East.

book.title: Resurrecting Empire
book.subtitle: Western Footprints and America's Perilous Path in the Middle East

book.title: Ottoman Endgame
book.subtitle: War, Revolution and the Making of the Modern Middle East, 1908-1923

notes.p: This book was assigned by Dr. Wender in his History of Western Imperialism in the Middle East and North Africa class (HSTR 379).

book.title: Carbon Democracy
book.subtitle: Political Power in the Age of Oil
book.summary: Mitchell aims to look at how the structures of the oil industry influence and inhibit the development of democracy in certain parts of the world.

notes.p: This book was assigned by Dr. Wender in his History of Western Imperialism in the Middle East and North Africa class (HSTR 379). I wrote a reading analysis on this book.
I bought this book when I was researching the history of the 1948 War and the creation of the Palestinian refugee crisis.

book.title: The Idea of Israel
book.subtitle: A History of Power and Knowledge

notes.p: I bought this book when I was researching the history of the 1948 War and the creation of the Palestinian refugee crisis.
This book was assigned by Dr. Biddiscombe in his History of Nationalism seminar (HSTR 470).
This book was assigned by Dr. Biddiscombe in his History of Nationalism seminar (HSTR 470).
This book was assigned by Dr. Biddiscombe in his History of Nationalism seminar (HSTR 470).

book.title: Blood and Belonging
book.subtitle: Journeys into the New Nationalism
book.summary: An informal study on the apparent outbreak of nationalist conflicts around the end of the twentieth century. He looks specifically at Yugoslavia, Kurdistan, Northern Ireland, Quebec, Germany, and the former Soviet republics.

notes.p: This book was assigned by Dr. Biddiscombe in his History of Nationalism seminar.
This book was assigned by Dr. Biddiscombe in his History of Nationalism seminar (HSTR 470).

book.title: The Unredeemed Captive
book.subtitle: A Family Story from Early America
book.rating: 3 - Like, but probably won't read again

book.title: Apocalypse
book.subtitle: From Antiquity to the Empire of Modernity

notes.p: This book was assigned by Dr. Wender in his History of Modern Messianic Movements seminar (HSTR 470). I ended up dropping the class but was unable to return this book due to damage from a tea spill.

book.title: Why Europe Grew Rich and Asia Did Not
book.subtitle: Global Economic Divergence, 1600-1850

notes.p: This book was assigned by Dr. Beam the Honours History seminar that I took in third year.
This book was assigned in a World War II history class that I took in first year.
This book was assigned by Dr. Biddiscombe in his Twentieth Century World History class (HSTR 100).

book.title: Lighting the Eighth Fire
book.subtitle: The Liberation, Resurgence, and Protection of Indigenous Nations
book.summary: A collection of essays by leading Indigenous scholars writing in a Canadian context.

notes.p: This book was assigned in a political science class on Indigenous Politics in Canada. However, I ended up having to drop this class.
This book was assigned in the Writ 100 class I took in first year.

notes.p: This book was assigned in Karen Rivers Writing for Children and Young Adults (WRIT 406).
